text: The 1913 Washington State football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1913 college football season. The team competed as an independent under head coach John R. Bender, compiling a record of 4–4. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 4 | Bremerton Navy | Home | 26-12 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 11 | Montana | Home | 34-9 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 17 | Idaho | Away | 0-3 L | 2,500 |- ! scope="row" | October 25 | Multnomah AC | Away | 0-7 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 1 | Gonzaga | Home | 26-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 8 | Whitman | Home | 23-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 15 | Oregon State | Away | 2-10 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 27 | Washington | Away | 0-20 L | NA |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1913 in Washington (state)
